soc.game

Enum GameState

    • java.lang.Enum<GameState>

    public enum GameState
extends java.lang.Enum<GameState>

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • NEW_GAME

        public static final GameState NEW_GAME
        Game states. NEW_GAME is a brand-new game, not yet ready to start playing. Players are choosing where to sit, or have all sat but no one has yet clicked the "start game" button. The board is empty sea, with no land hexes yet. Next state from NEW_GAME is READY if robots, or START1A if only humans are playing.

        General assumptions for states and their numeric values:

        • Any scenario-specific initial pieces, such as those in SC_PIRI, are sent while game state is still < START1A.
        • Active game states are >= START1A and < GAME_OVER
        • Initial placement ends after START2B or START3B, going directly to ROLL_OR_CARD
        • A Normal turn's "main phase" is PLAY1, after dice-roll/card-play in ROLL_OR_CARD
        • When the game is waiting for a player to react to something, state is > PLAY1, < GAME_OVER; state name starts with PLACING_ or WAITING_
        • While reloading and resuming a saved game, state is LOADING, barely < GAME_OVER. Some code may want to check state < LOADING instead of < GAME_OVER.

        The code reacts to (switches based on) game state in several places. The main places to check, if you add a game state:

        • SOCBoardPanel.updateMode()
        • SOCBuildingPanel.updateButtonStatus()
        • SOCPlayerInterface.updateAtGameState()
        • SOCGame.putPiece(SOCPlayingPiece)
        • SOCGame.advanceTurnStateAfterPutPiece()
        • SOCGame.forceEndTurn()
        • SOCRobotBrain.run()
        • SOCGameHandler.sendGameState(SOCGame)
        • SOCGameState javadoc list of states with related messages and client responses
        Also, if your state is similar to an existing state, do a where-used search for that state, and decide where both states should be reacted to.

        If your new state might be waiting for several players (not just the current player) to respond with a choice (such as picking resources to discard or gain), also update GameHandler.endTurnIfInactive(SOCGame, long). Otherwise the robot will be forced to lose its turn while waiting for human players.

        Other places to check, if you add a game state:

        • SOCBoardPanel.BoardPopupMenu.showBuild, showCancelBuild
        • SOCBoardPanel.drawBoard
        • SOCHandPanel.addPlayer, began, removePlayer, updateAtTurn, updateValue
        • SOCGame.addPlayer
        • SOCServerMessageHandler.handleSTARTGAME
        • Your game type's GameHandler.leaveGame, sitDown, GameMessageHandler.handleCANCELBUILDREQUEST, handlePUTPIECE
        • SOCPlayerClient.handleCANCELBUILDREQUEST, SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient.handleCANCELBUILDREQUEST

      • READY

        public static final GameState READY
        Ready to start playing. All humans have chosen a seat. Wait for requested robots to sit down. Once robots have joined the game (this happens in other threads, possibly in other processes), gameState will become START1A.
        See Also:
        READY_RESET_WAIT_ROBOT_DISMISS, LOADING_RESUMING

      • READY_RESET_WAIT_ROBOT_DISMISS

        public static final GameState READY_RESET_WAIT_ROBOT_DISMISS
        This game object has just been created by a reset, but the old game contains robot players, so we must wait for them to leave before re-inviting anyone to continue the reset process. Once they have all left, state becomes READY. See SOCGame.boardResetOngoingInfo and (private) SOCServer.resetBoardAndNotify.
        Since:
        1.1.07

      • START1A

        public static final GameState START1A
        Players place first settlement. Proceed in order for each player; next state is START1B to place each player's 1st road.

      • START1B

        public static final GameState START1B
        Players place first road. Next state is START1A to place next player's 1st settlement, or if all have placed settlements, START2A to place 2nd settlement.

      • START2A

        public static final GameState START2A
        Players place second settlement. Proceed in reverse order for each player; next state is START2B to place 2nd road. If the settlement is placed on a Gold Hex, the next state is STARTS_WAITING_FOR_PICK_GOLD_RESOURCE.

        If game scenario option _SC_3IP is set, then instead of this second settlement giving resources, a third round of placement will do that; next game state after START2A remains START2B.

      • START2B

        public static final GameState START2B
        Players place second road. Next state is START2A to place previous player's 2nd settlement (player changes in reverse order), or if all have placed settlements, ROLL_OR_CARD to begin first player's turn.

        If game scenario option _SC_3IP is set, then instead of starting normal play, a third settlement and road are placed by each player, with game state START3A.

      • START3A

        public static final GameState START3A
        (Game scenarios) Players place third settlement. Proceed in normal order for each player; next state is START3B to place 3rd road. If the settlement is placed on a Gold Hex, the next state is STARTS_WAITING_FOR_PICK_GOLD_RESOURCE.

        Valid only when game scenario option _SC_3IP is set.

      • START3B

        public static final GameState START3B
        Players place third road. Next state is START3A to place previous player's 3rd settlement (player changes in normal order), or if all have placed settlements, ROLL_OR_CARD to begin first player's turn.

        Valid only when game scenario option _SC_3IP is set.

      • STARTS_WAITING_FOR_PICK_GOLD_RESOURCE

        public static final GameState STARTS_WAITING_FOR_PICK_GOLD_RESOURCE
        Just placed an initial piece, waiting for current player to choose which Gold Hex resources to receive. This can happen after the second or third initial settlement, or (with the fog scenario _SC_FOG) when any initial road, settlement, or ship reveals a gold hex.

        The next game state will be based on oldGameState, which is the state whose placement led to STARTS_WAITING_FOR_PICK_GOLD_RESOURCE. For settlements not revealed from fog: Next game state is START2B to place 2nd road. If game scenario option _SC_3IP is set, next game state can be START3B.

        Valid only when SOCGame.hasSeaBoard, settlement adjacent to SOCBoardLarge.GOLD_HEX, or gold revealed from SOCBoardLarge.FOG_HEX by a placed road, ship, or settlement.

        This is the highest-numbered possible starting state; value is ROLL_OR_CARD - 1.

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        WAITING_FOR_PICK_GOLD_RESOURCE, SOCGame.pickGoldHexResources(int, SOCResourceSet)

      • ROLL_OR_CARD

        public static final GameState ROLL_OR_CARD
        Start of a normal turn: Time to roll or play a card. Next state depends on card or roll, but usually is PLAY1.

        If 7 is rolled, might be WAITING_FOR_DISCARDS or WAITING_FOR_ROBBER_OR_PIRATE or PLACING_ROBBER or PLACING_PIRATE.

        If 7 is rolled with scenario option _SC_PIRI, there is no robber to move, but the player will choose their robbery victim (WAITING_FOR_ROB_CHOOSE_PLAYER) after any discards.

        If the number rolled is on a gold hex, next state might be WAITING_FOR_PICK_GOLD_RESOURCE.

        More special notes for scenario _SC_PIRI: When the dice is rolled, the pirate fleet moves along a path, and attacks the sole player with an adjacent settlement to the pirate hex, if any. This is resolved before any of the normal dice-rolling actions (distributing resources, handling a 7, etc.) If the player ties or loses (pirate fleet is stronger than player's fleet of warships), the roll is handled as normal, as described above. If the player wins, they get to pick a random resource. Unless the roll is 7, this can be dealt with along with other gained resources (gold hexes). So: If the player wins and the roll is 7, the player must pick their resource before any normal 7 discarding. In that case only, the next state is WAITING_FOR_PICK_GOLD_RESOURCE, which will be followed by WAITING_FOR_DISCARDS or WAITING_FOR_ROB_CHOOSE_PLAYER.

        Before v2.0.00 this state was named PLAY.

      • DICE_ROLLED

        public static final GameState DICE_ROLLED
        Dice were rolled, and results reported, but we're not quite ready to begin play yet.

      • SENDING_DICE_RESULT_RESOURCES

        public static final GameState SENDING_DICE_RESULT_RESOURCES

      • PLAY1

        public static final GameState PLAY1
        Done rolling (or moving robber on 7) and all additional resources have been gained (or lost) Time for other turn actions, such as building or buying or trading, or playing a dev card if not already done. Next state depends on what's done, but usually is the next player's ROLL_OR_CARD.

      • PLACING_ROAD

        public static final GameState PLACING_ROAD

      • PLACING_SETTLEMENT

        public static final GameState PLACING_SETTLEMENT

      • PLACING_CITY

        public static final GameState PLACING_CITY

      • PLACING_ROBBER

        public static final GameState PLACING_ROBBER
        Player is placing the robber on a new land hex. May follow state WAITING_FOR_ROBBER_OR_PIRATE if the game SOCGame.hasSeaBoard.

        Possible next game states:

        • PLAY1, after robbing no one or the single possible victim; from oldGameState
        • WAITING_FOR_ROB_CHOOSE_PLAYER if multiple possible victims
        • In scenario _SC_CLVI, WAITING_FOR_ROB_CLOTH_OR_RESOURCE if the victim has cloth and has resources
        • GAME_OVER, if current player just won by gaining Largest Army (when there aren't multiple possible victims or another robber-related choice to make)
        See Also:
        PLACING_PIRATE, SOCGame.canMoveRobber(int, int), SOCGame.moveRobber(int, int)

      • PLACING_PIRATE

        public static final GameState PLACING_PIRATE
        Player is placing the pirate ship on a new water hex, in a game which SOCGame.hasSeaBoard. May follow state WAITING_FOR_ROBBER_OR_PIRATE. Has the same possible next game states as PLACING_ROBBER.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        SOCGame.canMovePirate(int, int), SOCGame.movePirate(int, int)

      • PLACING_SHIP

        public static final GameState PLACING_SHIP
        This game SOCGame.hasSeaBoard, and a player has bought and is placing a ship.
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • PLACING_FREE_ROAD1

        public static final GameState PLACING_FREE_ROAD1
        Player is placing their first free road/ship. If SOCGame.getCurrentDice() == 0, the Road Building card was played before rolling the dice.

      • PLACING_FREE_ROAD2

        public static final GameState PLACING_FREE_ROAD2
        Player is placing their second free road/ship. If SOCGame.getCurrentDice() == 0, the Road Building card was played before rolling the dice.

      • PLACING_INV_ITEM

        public static final GameState PLACING_INV_ITEM
        Player is placing the special SOCInventoryItem held in SOCGame.getPlacingItem(). For some kinds of item, placement can sometimes be canceled by calling SOCGame.cancelPlaceInventoryItem(boolean).

        The placement method depends on the scenario and item type; for example, _SC_FTRI has trading port items and would call SOCGame.placePort(int).

        Placement requires its own game state (not PLAY1) because sometimes it's triggered by the game after another action, not initiated by player request.

        When setting this gameState: In case placement is canceled, set oldGameState to PLAY1 or SPECIAL_BUILDING.

        Since:
        2.0.00

      • WAITING_FOR_DISCARDS

        public static final GameState WAITING_FOR_DISCARDS
        Waiting for player(s) to discard, after 7 is rolled in SOCGame.rollDice(). Next game state is WAITING_FOR_DISCARDS (if other players still need to discard), WAITING_FOR_ROBBER_OR_PIRATE, or PLACING_ROBBER.

        In scenario option _SC_PIRI, there is no robber to move, but the player will choose their robbery victim (WAITING_FOR_ROB_CHOOSE_PLAYER) after any discards. If there are no possible victims, next state is PLAY1.

        See Also:
        SOCGame.discard(int, ResourceSet)

      • WAITING_FOR_ROB_CHOOSE_PLAYER

        public static final GameState WAITING_FOR_ROB_CHOOSE_PLAYER
        Waiting for player to choose a player to rob, with the robber or pirate ship, after rolling 7 or playing a Knight/Soldier card. Next game state is PLAY1, WAITING_FOR_ROB_CLOTH_OR_RESOURCE, or GAME_OVER if player just won by gaining Largest Army.

        To see whether we're moving the robber or the pirate, use SOCGame.getRobberyPirateFlag(). To choose the player, call SOCGame.choosePlayerForRobbery(int).

        In scenario option _SC_PIRI, there is no robber to move, but the player will choose their robbery victim. SOCGame.currentRoll.sc_clvi_robPossibleVictims holds the list of possible victims. In that scenario, the player also doesn't control the pirate ships, and never has Knight cards to move the robber and steal.

        So in that scenario, the only time the game state is WAITING_FOR_ROB_CHOOSE_PLAYER is when the player must choose to steal from a possible victim, or choose to steal from no one, after a 7 is rolled. To choose the victim, call SOCGame.choosePlayerForRobbery(int). To choose no one, call choosePlayerForRobbery(-1).

        Before v2.0.00, this game state was called WAITING_FOR_CHOICE.

        See Also:
        SOCGame.playKnight(), SOCGame.canChoosePlayer(int), SOCGame.canChooseRobClothOrResource(int), SOCGame.stealFromPlayer(int, boolean)

      • WAITING_FOR_DISCOVERY

        public static final GameState WAITING_FOR_DISCOVERY
        Waiting for player to choose 2 resources (Discovery card) Next game state is PLAY1.

      • WAITING_FOR_MONOPOLY

        public static final GameState WAITING_FOR_MONOPOLY
        Waiting for player to choose a resource (Monopoly card) Next game state is PLAY1.

      • WAITING_FOR_ROBBER_OR_PIRATE

        public static final GameState WAITING_FOR_ROBBER_OR_PIRATE
        Waiting for player to choose the robber or the pirate ship, after SOCGame.rollDice() or SOCGame.playKnight(). Next game state is PLACING_ROBBER or PLACING_PIRATE.

        Moving from WAITING_FOR_ROBBER_OR_PIRATE to those states preserves oldGameState.

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        SOCGame.canChooseMovePirate(), SOCGame.chooseMovePirate(boolean), WAITING_FOR_DISCARDS

      • WAITING_FOR_ROB_CLOTH_OR_RESOURCE

        public static final GameState WAITING_FOR_ROB_CLOTH_OR_RESOURCE
        Waiting for player to choose whether to rob cloth or rob a resource. Previous game state is PLACING_PIRATE or WAITING_FOR_ROB_CHOOSE_PLAYER. Next step: Call SOCGame.stealFromPlayer(int, boolean) with result of that player's choice.

        Next game state is PLAY1, or GAME_OVER if player just won by gaining Largest Army.

        Used with scenario option _SC_CLVI.

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        SOCGame.movePirate(int, int), SOCGame.canChooseRobClothOrResource(int)

      • WAITING_FOR_PICK_GOLD_RESOURCE

        public static final GameState WAITING_FOR_PICK_GOLD_RESOURCE
        Waiting for player(s) to choose which Gold Hex resources to receive. Next game state is usually PLAY1, sometimes PLACING_FREE_ROAD2 or SPECIAL_BUILDING. (SOCGame.oldGameState holds the next state after this WAITING state.)

        Valid only when SOCGame.hasSeaBoard, settlements or cities adjacent to SOCBoardLarge.GOLD_HEX.

        When receiving this state from server, a client shouldn't immediately check their user player's SOCPlayer.getNeedToPickGoldHexResources() or prompt the user to pick resources; those players' clients will be sent a SOCSimpleRequest.PROMPT_PICK_RESOURCES message shortly.

        If scenario option _SC_PIRI is active, this state is also used when a 7 is rolled and the player has won against a pirate fleet attack. They must choose a free resource. SOCGame.oldGameState is ROLL_OR_CARD. Then, the 7 is resolved as normal. See ROLL_OR_CARD javadoc for details. That's the only time free resources are picked on rolling 7.

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        STARTS_WAITING_FOR_PICK_GOLD_RESOURCE, SOCGame.pickGoldHexResources(int, SOCResourceSet)

      • SPECIAL_BUILDING

        public static final GameState SPECIAL_BUILDING
        The 6-player board's Special Building Phase. Takes place at the end of any player's normal turn (roll, place, etc). The Special Building Phase changes SOCGame.currentPlayerNumber. So, it begins by calling SOCGame.advanceTurn() to the next player, and continues clockwise until SOCGame.currentPlayerNumber == SOCGame.specialBuildPhase_afterPlayerNumber. At that point, the Special Building Phase is over, and it's the next player's turn as usual.
        Since:
        1.1.08

      • LOADING

        public static final GameState LOADING
        A saved game is being loaded. Its actual state is saved in field oldGameState. Bots have joined to sit in seats which were bots in the saved game, and human seats are currently unclaimed except for the requesting user if they were named as a player. Before resuming play, server or user may need to satisfy conditions or constraints (have a certain type of bot sit down at a given player number, etc). If there are unclaimed non-vacant seats where bots will need to join, next state is LOADING_RESUMING, otherwise will resume at oldGameState.

        This game state is higher-numbered than actively-playing states, slightly lower than GAME_OVER or LOADING_RESUMING.

        Since:
        2.3.00

      • LOADING_RESUMING

        public static final GameState LOADING_RESUMING
        A saved game was loaded and is about to resume, now waiting for some bots to rejoin. Game's actual state is saved in field oldGameState. Before we can resume play, server has requested some bots to fill unclaimed non-vacant seats, which had humans when the game was saved. Server is waiting for the bots to join and sit down (like state READY). Once all bots have joined, gameState can resume at oldGameState.

        This game state is higher-numbered than actively-playing states, slightly lower than GAME_OVER but higher than LOADING.

        Since:
        2.3.00

      • ALMOST_OVER

        public static final GameState ALMOST_OVER
        Convenience value for testing whether game state is GAME_OVER or greater.

      • GAME_OVER

        public static final GameState GAME_OVER
        The game is over. A player has accumulated enough (SOCGame.vp_winner) victory points, or all players have left the game. The winning player, if any, is SOCGame.getPlayerWithWin().
        See Also:
        SOCGame.checkForWinner()

      • RESET_OLD

        public static final GameState RESET_OLD
        This game is an obsolete old copy of a new (reset) game with the same name. To assist logic, numeric constant value is greater than GAME_OVER.
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        SOCGame.resetAsCopy(), SOCGame.getOldGameState()

      • INVALID

        public static final GameState INVALID

    • Method Detail

      • values

        public static GameState[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (GameState c : GameState.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the enum constant with the specified name
        Throws:
